My daughter said their only problem is limiting the time he uses it. It was an instant hit. Can't give more feedback because they're in the midwest and I'm in the east, but they are not usually effusive about my choice of gifts--this time mother and son both were. YEAH.

I purchased this bundle a month ago, and have had a problem with getting the "rechargeable" battery pack to charge. I contacted customer service, and their first response was to send me four AA batteries. Then they told me to buy a new AC adapter. When I did that and still didn't get a charge, I was told that the charger isn't meant to charge the batteries. I was confused, but the reason they said this was because they, for some reason, were assuming that I was talking about regular store-bought rechargeable batteries. When I cleared that up, I was told that the item was no longer covered under warranty, because it's been longer than three months- which it hasn't been. Obviously. So far, with accessories and apps included, I have spent nearly $200 on a product for my son that won't do the main advertised function- charge. I suggest you put your money into another company, because LeapFrog is just awful.
We purchased this for a Christmas present to our granddaughter.  So far, we have set it up, charged the batteries, and everything seems ok
Free apps are pretty lame otherwise great teaching tool that keeps children busy in places like doctor offices, in the car, etc.

My kids (5yrs and 3yrs) both have and had leap pads. I purchased them last Christmas and only one remains. 3 days after my daughter had her first one, the screen broke. Of course we know that kids can be rough sometimes, but at the time she was playing, I was fully monitoring her (let's face it-- these things are not cheap)! She merely pressed her stylus on a button (no slamming or rough playing) and "crack" the screen went. I notified leapfrog and they immediately replaced it which was incredibly awesome and hassle free! The shipping time was just as incredible.. I was very pleased with their response and time management. However, 9 months after the replacement, my daughter was again playing while sitting on the bed with me and she bumped her arm on the end table with stylus in hand and "crack" the screen went again. I have not replaced it after that and refuse to. Don't get me wrong, the games, apps, learning, etc. of this product is nothing less than amazing and will keep your kids busy for hours! It's great on long road trips, etc. The particular package offered here IS an excellent deal with all that is included, but I do caution you, the screens on these tablets are not indestructible. In fact, they're surprisingly  fragile. I was quite annoyed that with a product that is this costly for a young child, the screens would be significantly more durable. I am not telling you to not purchase the product because it's absolutely fabulous, but I feel as a mother who purchased two of these, and had dealt with this personally, I should be forthcoming and give my opinion. My son (who is younger) still has his leap pad and is only able to use it under extensive supervision (as with most electronics/toys).
Again, I love the Leap Frog toys and this is the 3rd leap pad I,ve gotten this year & I know the little guy will love it.

I purchased this item due to that it includes the rechargeable battery pack (which costs about $29 if purchased separately).  I made a smart purchase because if I would have purchased the item itself without the battery pack .. I would be wasting a lot of AA batteries!!!

We bought the LeapPad as a birthday gift for our 3-year-old who is just learning to hear, after having tubes put in his ears.  A whole new world has opened up for him and he is soaking up new information.  We planned to take the Pad on a trip to Mexico with him, and it may be the best investment we have ever made.  He played with it on the plane, in the car, and in the hotel rooms when it got dark outside but he was too wired to go to sleep.  He has already learned a lot from it and his motor skills have taken a big leap forward.  I love it!

Bought this for my granddaughter who will be three next month.  She loves it.  Recently went to Amazon and ordered some additional games, but they are for Christmas, so I don't how she will do with them.  I rely on the reviews of others when purchasing from Amazon, so I selected the games according to previous reviews.  Will soon find out if she likes them.

The only downside is that you may want to open it and set it up first. It's what I did and I was glad, so Christmas morning she can play her heart out! Other than that these are great investments in kids entertainment! Product got here quick!

Well my niece loved it and my sister said that it was very easy to use and the recharger actually was a benefit, but when we recieved the product the skins did not come with it so she was a little disappointed about that. It truely is a great product especially for long car rides.

It's built like a tank. It holds the kids' interest for many hours, the batteries are rechargeable, BUT...expect to cough up some serious cash in games. It's not like the iPad, iPod or iPhone, where you can find freebies. Every stinking game requires you to take out a second mortgage for very little entertainment. My children received both the iPad and the LeapFrog, and the toddler still hovers over the teenager to play games.

While my daughter is going to love the Doc McStuffins LeapPad2 for Christmas, I can only give this product 4 stars because the first one I ordered didn't respond to the stylus. The second one is perfect.
I bought this for my neighbor's little girl for Christmas, I opened and programed it for her, what a neat little electronic for little ones. I can't wait for her to open it on Christmas morning.
I ordered this tablet in pink, but I received it in green instead. Bummer. I will still keep it though because I have a pink gel skin to put on it.

Apps are expensive! My wife talked me into buying this thing vs getting a cheap android tablet with a big case. This is going to end up costing a lot more than the other device and does a lot less. I see no benefits to this device vs a cheap "real" tablet and installing some of the 20,000 FREE apps on the Android market. You can't even get it to play music without spending another $10!!

i wanted to buy something that is more appropriate for my 2 and 1/2 year-old son to play with, so based on the good reviews i bought Leappad 2. However, after i received the item and installed it, it kinda disappointed me, the included 9 apps were not as good as i thought, in fact they were quite boring. The most disappointing part was the resolution of the camera, it was quite low, not as clear as the video ad that i saw online. Just Like other reviewers have mentioned, whatever app you wanna download they are quite expensive. if you want more educational apps or games for your child they're gonna cost you a fortune. Besides all those cons, my son really likes ipad a lot better than leappad 2 cuz he can get many music video online and save them to my ipad, and the games many are for free.
BEST deal I have ever found on these Leappad 2 Power tablets. It works perfectly and we were able to get the actual Doc McStuffins game with the $20 card. LOVE it.

Bought this as a christmas gift for my 3 yr old, looks like a brand new product! I'm excited that she will be able to learn with this product, games, art, and video cameras came with a battery and charger!

I haven't had much time to play with this since it is a Christmas gift for my daughter but so far I am very pleased. It was very easy to set up, I just connected it to my home computer, logged into my LeapFrog account (if you don't have a LeapFrog account that to is very easy to set up) and it immediately recognized the device. It took only a few minutes to install needed programs and it was ready to go. Rechargeable batteries did needed to be charged but once again it didn't take very long. It came with 7 apps which seem to be really nice and the front and back camera takes really great pics! Very pleased with purchase!

my daughter is getting this as a christmas gift so we haven't used it yet, but the battery charger and $20 gift that comes with this is wonderfull.ont have to buy batteries that will die after 2 hours of play and need to be recharged as it says the charger works for 9 hours before needingto be recharged...the $20 gift card will allow for my daughter to get some games that aren't included in the ones already given to you...her cousin has a disney princess one and she loves playing on that.. for the price i paid for this one.. it is great and brand new with warrenties.. you cant beat that...no one had a set like this for the i paid for everything...i know my daughter will love this and play it for years to come
MY DAUGHTER WILL LOVE LOVE LOVE IT COME CHRISTMAS MORNING!! I JUST HOPE IM NOT MORE EXCITED THAN SHE'LL BE.

Unfortunately, Leap Frog is not longer our educational system of choice. Three days ago my 4 year old daughter's Leappad2 stopped turning on. We purchased this product in April (2013). I called the customer service, and was informed of the hoops I would have to jump through in order for them to send me another. I informed them it was now 3 weeks until Christmas, and by the time I completed all of the requirement Christmas would be over, including my daughter receiving new games for a Leappad 2 she couldn't use. They informed me they would attempt to get approval for another Leappad 2 without having to go through all the steps, and this would take about 24-48 hours. We have yet to hear from them now 4 days later. For a product that is totally, 100% child friendly, the customer service surely is not geared towards making the child happy! I now have a 4 year old who asks for her "game" every day, and having to tell her it is broken only after 8 months, is simply pitiful!! I would never recommend another Leap Frog product to any of my friends or family....EVER again!!!
My daughter loves it...she takes pictures and plays games on it...it almost reminds her of my kindle. I'm very happy with this product

This set looks good, got it for my 4 yr old grand-daughter who loves Doc McStuffins and loves using her older sister's Leap Pad.  I wish it came with a case but other then that a great set.  I got it as a lightening deal during black Friday which made it even better too.

I cannot say enough wonderful things about the leap pad. I love all of the educational games, books, fun music. My 4 year old loves hers so much I purchased my nieces one too.  They feel like they have their own tablet and its all safe stuff instead of giving them access to an I pad or something and they see something they shouldnt

We have bought so many LeapFrog products over the last couple of years (3 kids, 6-8 years old) and they have always been a hit and lasted. The LeapPads are a great line of products for satisfying our boy's wishes for tablets this Christmas but it's a bit of a touch decision on what one to get. For me, the biggest difference between the LeapPads is that only the Ultra has WiFi built in which makes it most like a "real" tablet. It does push the cost up to where you could nearly buy a good adult tablet but then those are not designed with kids in mind. In the end, I thing the LeapPad Ultra Kids' tablet is they way to go. B00CS1WDBI
Love this Leappad 2. So glad we returned the Innotabs. DEFINITLY worth the extra money! Love how easy it is to use and the video and music features.

I would HIGHLY suggest getting the LeapPad2 Power, vs. the regular LeapPad2.  It easy to charge and you'll save a good bit in the long run.  My cousin told me they change their batteries about once a month!  Glad we don't have to!
It is a great toy for my toddler. I would like for it to be a bit more durable. I love that it has so many apps and games to choose from. Overall great product!

I love the fact that it comes with rechargeable batteries and a plug in charger. My daughter is crazy about Doc McStuffins and the leappad 2 edition won out over the Doc McStuffins Innotab 3s edition because I've only ever had issues with Vtech products. Everything went smoothly with the set up until it was time to download the free app of my choice. There are zero apps listed, zero trailers to watch to preview the apps, etc. I've tried installing the Connect platform on my laptop and desktop computers. Both encounter the same setup problem of not being able to download the free app. I've downloaded apps from the app center and they work perfectly on the device. My daughter can't miss what isn't there, right? Overall, except for the one hiccup in the setup process, this is an excellent product.

This is an absolutely wonderful tablet.  Our 3, 5, & 7 year old children all love it--probably because it adapts to their levels.  Each child signs in by touching his/her name on the screen (our 3-year-old can turn it on, sign in, and play a game, watch a video, or listen to an e-book all by herself), and each child has a personalized background.  We still read "real" books regularly, but the Leappad 2 gives our youngest a way to "read" all by herself.  My wife and I can keep track of their playing time and their progress on our computer through the online (it helps to highlight problem areas).

I really don't understand the reviews that criticize the cost of the apps., as It is a system rather than a stand-alone toy and each new app./e-book/video adds to its usefulness and longevity in the same way that a new game adds value to a Playstation or Xbox console.  The difference is that the Leapfrog apps. actually teach--in a way that is as fun (really) as a video game.  Honestly, does your child really enjoy those math flash cards?  And what is it worth to help your child learn to blend letter sounds into words in an enjoyable way?  It is helpful, however, to buy the $20 card from Amazon at a discount ($15 = an instant 25% savings) and then double up on the discount at the Leapfrog site.

This is a solid product all around, my one gripe is that thought it says it's multiple language option the only ones are English, British English and French. I needed it in Spanish for my little nephew and was sorely let down. Amazon, please include that information in the products description.

I was more than excited to recieve this product for my daughter. Shipment time was perfect, much much earlier than expected and product is very child friendly but my front camera doesn't work which was disappointing to me and time factor wouldn't allow me to send it back.
Durable, easy to understand and set up, came with everything I needed and keeps my boys entertained on long road trips!
Everything about the site made it very easy for me to order.  the delivery was easy to track and on time. i would not hesitate to use this site again

My son who is 3 and advanced enough to use an iPad on his own very well, just doesn't like this.  It's slow compared to a Kindle Fire or an iPad, it's very heavy as well.  The games seem to be monotonous and aren't much fun to him.  We have educational games on the iPad that he enjoys for one or two dollars.  Try to find a decent game for this under 25 dollars.  Bottom line this was purchased to give the kids a more rugged "computer" of their own.  I have to ask and pester him to play with this and he doesn't do so for long if he even concedes and picks it up.  I feel like this was a colossal waste of money for us.

Watched the lightning deal countdown to a deal on this item on Nov 23, 2013.
When the timer hit zero to start the lightning deal, it instantly changed to '100% claimed'.
Rating is for Amazon handling of early black Friday deals, not the product.  Maybe that's not fair.
As for the product itself, I had a leap pad 1.  It had good built in games, and purchased games were high quality but expensive.  The display shorted out at 3 months, rendering it useless. The device was never dropped.
I have had better luck with other LeapFrog products.

We bought this as a Christmas gift for our 4 year old daughter so she hasn't used it yet but I have. I'm so glad we got the bundle with the $20 card. We also got 30% off so I got her 5 more apps and only paid $3! Yes the apps can be a little expensive compared to an adult tablet but I consider it more of a gaming system than a tablet and compared to game prices these really aren't that bad. I know this is going to be a big hit come Christmas morning and I feel better with her using this rather than our tablet

Awesome toy. MASSIVE improvement over the first Leappad.

I purchased this for my 2 years 9 month old son. I bought one cartridge for it on Amazon also (Cars Ultra Book) and then a $20 Leapfrog download card to put digital games/books on the Leappad2 instead of buying more cartridges that will just get lost.
I got both these two extra items for a massive discount on Amazon as opposed to in a store.(totally worth it on here). The Leappad2 came with some great apps already on it (like an Art Studio), and there are two download codes you can use to get a free ebook and a free game (I can't find them now, but someone has them listed in one of their reviews a few pages back).

WHAT A GREAT TABLET! No, it's no iPad. No, it's not even an Android tablet or a Kindle. It runs a lot slower and clunkier than any of those types of tablets, and the graphics aren't nearly as nice. There is no wifi, but seriously, what 2-5 year old needs wifi? (not mine, anyway!). The graphics are perfectly fine for a young child. This is a great introductory tablet for a 2-5 year old. It easily introduces them into our electronic-digital world, in a nice, easy, kid friendly learning fun fashion. LOVE IT!

I was even able to download cartoons (Bubble Guppies and The Wonder Pets) from the Leapfrog Connect store. Yes, the apps/books/games in there can be really pricey - but if you go buy the download cards from here on Amazon when they're on sale (like, a $20 download card for $14) it's a great deal. There's not any $1 or $2 apps like in the android or apple market, and I DO wish the Leapfrog stuff was cheaper, but I get why they're not, and I'm still willing to pay it if I can get the download cards several dollars off on here. There are $5 games, but most of the ebooks and games start at $7.50. The full cartridge games they have for download are $25 (I won't pay that - I'd rather just buy an actual cartridge here on Amazon for cheaper).

The rechargeable battery pack on here is GREAT!! NO MORE BUYING BATTERIES! We had the Leappad1 a couple years ago, and I was having to replace the batteries every few days. This is a steal. You don't have to take the batteries out to recharge them, you just plug it into the wall and the power button lights up yellow while it's charging, and will turn off when it's done.

He can easily navigate the tablet. He knows how to go between each game, and the "back" buttons and "home" buttons and "turn page" buttons are easy for him to figure out. It's rugged and sturdy. It's easy to wipe clean. It feels like a polished, perfected product.

I don't recommend this toy for a child over 6 years of age - this is more of a younger age group. My older children have had experience with iPads and things like that, and they each have a Nintendo 3DS - and this is nothing in comparison. It may hold a 6, 7 or 8 year olds attention briefly - but I can't seem them staying interested for long and they'd get bored quickly, or move on to wanting a better toy (like a Nintendo 3DS or something), and this is a lot of money to spend for them to just outgrow it in a year or less. But for a 2, 3, 4, 5 year old - it's a gold mine. My little boy just loves knowing he has an electronic toy just like the big kids!

UPDATE - My 2.9 month old has been playing with this constantly for the last couple weeks, he just loves it. I wound up purchasing some additional cartridge games (Jake & The Neverland Pirates and Bubble Guppies) for it (3 year old age group) and he LOVES them! They're great for his age, he can even pull the little green cartridge out and switch it himself. He's dropped food on it and slobbered on the screen and I just use a bit of windex and wipe it right off. He's also dropped it multiple times, but this thing is a tank, we've had no issues. The battery pack is still charging just fine, he can play it with it for roughly 3 days (maybe 4) before I need to give it another charge. We're still going strong and he is in love with it! He even started referring to my iPad as a "weepad!"

UPDATE 2 (November 26th, 2014!) My son has had this for over a year now, and it is STILL WORKING PERFECTLY and he STILL PLAYS WITH IT DAILY! What he mostly uses it for is the cartoons that I put on it via the Leapfrog store. Yes, it can get a bit expensive, but I still think it's worth it. It's rugged, sturdy, portable, easy to clean, and while my other kids are playing with the iPad and my husband is using the TV, my 3 year old has his own little "tablet" to watch cartoons on. A year later and this is still money well spent. A+.

I love the Leap series.  They have soooo many tools that there is no way your child will not learn.  The Leap series is also better when you want them to learn versus just playing games.  I bought this to share between both my kids.  Almost all the games will work in it.  The only negative was that when the box arrived it said it included a USB cable.  Mine did not. Since I own other Leap frog items I have other cables so for me this was not an issue but for someone else you just need contact Amazon or Leapfrog website.  If you want advice the DVD sets from LeapFrog are also wonderful.  My 3 year old LOVES to watch the Letter Factory!

I bought this product for my almost 3 year old for Christmas. It was recommended to me by a friend whose son uses his every day and loves it. The first one I got was broken. It let me make a profile but once I charged the rechargeable batteries it would not power back on. I contacted Leapfrog and they suggested trying it with non rechargeable batteries. It still didn't work. I contacted Amazon and they shipped a new one immediately. So far the new one works fine.

The only thing I am disappointed in is how expensive the apps are. $25 is just ridiculous for an app for a child. There are cheaper ones, but all the "good" ones are $25.

I see a lot of people who gave the product bad review complaining about it being low resolution  and hokey. I personally would not be buying my 3 year old a Kindle Fire or iPad as some have suggested over this product. Its for a kid... I can't wait to give it to her and if she likes it who cares if it hokey, shes 3!

I will be updating my review after Christmas once she has gotten a chance to use it!

My 6 year old daughter already had a leapster and I thought this was the same thing but because it looks more like a grownups tablet she likes it more.  I like the variety of apps and they aren't expensive and they are very educational.  Really nice product from a solid and reliable company.
we love it and i come very fast it the best thing for my 3 yr old.super happy with it

My 3 year old daughter is LOVING her LeapPad2.  She was always asking to use my phone to play games.  Now, she's got her own device and is playing and learning at the same time.  She plays on it every day.  I do wish the games were a little less expensive ($15-$20 per game), as I can buy learning apps for my other devices for a lot less.  But, I still think this is a great item and I see my daughter using it for years to come.
great product! my son loved it. apps need to be purchased separately and they are not cheap! other than that, this thing looks and feels like it will stand the test of time

We ended up returning it for a Kindle when we realized that every single book, program, or application costs $10-30 or even higher. I mean come on!! How is this company even in business with all the high quality apps available for other devices at a fraction of the price (or free)!?!?! Nuts. Not worth the money at all and simply not versatile enough to grow with your kid either. Not good.
The Feature app is arrive nice and my son likes it he can't sleep Without Leapfrog. He learn a lot from leapfrog

She's getting bored with the installed apps.
UPDATE: First of all, we now have 5 games and reading apps and the 4 year old just loves it. She participates in choosing the next game/app and makes commitments about behavior to "earn" the new game. The latest purchase was the Brave game (22 levels). It was a hard game for me to figure out but she got it right away, and the game has in-play prompts that taught her things the adults couldn't figure out. We've been able to buy a few for as little as $9 (just put them in the shopping cart and watch the prices daily. They fall, then go back up, you just have to time it right).

Secondly, the unthinkable happened. She was getting help with the potty, and mom put it up on a shelf over the toilet. Unfortunately, it fell in (before any yucky in the potty). There was a My Little Pony cartridge in and it was turned on. We had bought a gel cover which was on.

The tablet cut out. We found a video online about how to take it apart (it was nerve wracking, and it was a unit a couple of years older, so slight differences) and we managed to get it apart without breaking anything. I put it in rice and we left it there a couple of days (this had worked for me on a cell phone once). It's been a month now and everything is working fine! Thank god because it was the adults who were falling apart worried that it was dead. My granddaughter had faith in us all along. Even the cartridge is fine.

REALLY REALLY well built unit.

I highly recommend this unit, as you will get your own tablet back from your toddlers. Just be prepared to buy lots and lots of games. She's reading on her own and her puzzle solving skills are amazing. And we don't have to worry about her downloading apps on her own or making in game purchases. Worth the investment.

Original review:
It's not a bad tablet, the display is smaller than I expected (about the size of a cellphone case), although with the frame it's about the size of an iPad. And the granddaughter was excited to get it.

 But she's been playing with more complicated apps on "her" cellphone (castoff Android). The installed apps are good for a couple of weeks amusement, but either buy at least one eBook or game  along with the leappad, because the installed apps are pretty lean. She likes the puppy/pet app that comes with it, but after 2 and a half weeks she asked for her phone back. We have an eBook cartridge on the way, so I'll update when she gets it and plays with it for a while.

I definitely recommend buying the cartridges (from Amazon, wow, the cost is so much lower) because we had multiple problems downloading the additional promised apps. So far, they're still not on the device. At $20-25 each the cartridges are too expensive to buy locally or on the Leapfrog website, so Amazon will get all of my cartridge orders. On average I'm seeing prices between $13-18 here.

Pay for the charger.

My five year old adores this electronic toy, and I'm amazed at how much it can actually do.  Beyond playing the games you can purchase, and besides the apps you can download from the LeapFrog website, the LeapPad also utilizes touch screen capabilities and a camera! In fact, it's very similar to a tablet in many ways.  Of course, it does not have wi-fi, nor does it claim to.  The included battery pack is a must-have feature, as this toy will burn through batteries quite quickly.  All in all, we've been very happy with our LeapFrog electronics, and the LeapPad has not disappointed in the least.  In fact, it exceeded my expectations!

We purchased a Leappad Power, we already owned two Leappad2s.  The Leappad Power came with certain apps to download ( calculator, calendar, etc.) that we didn't previously own.  When I tried to download these apps to the other two Leappads I received an error message saying that the apps were not linked to my account.  I called Leapfrog customer support and was told that if I wanted to download those apps on to the other Leappads, I would have to purchase them again!  Didn't I already purchase them when I paid for the Leappad Power?

Anybody who has multiple children of about the same age knows that, in order to keep the peace, all of the kids have to have the exact same item.  (This is why we own 3 Leappads to begin with.)  I was able to download on to the Leappad Power the apps that I had bought for the Leappad 2s.  I'm not sure why Leapfrog doesn't allow the apps from the Leappad Power to be shared within a family, but it's a very disappointing decision, especially for my children.

If you add this app annoyance to the sometimes buggy nature of the Leappad itself and especially of certain games like PetPals 2, I am not impressed by the product, or the company.

I ordered this as a present for my 6 year old grandson in the USA, so I haven't actually seen it myself but my daughter tells me that her son "absolutely loves it" and would play on it for hours if he could. It arrived a bit before the suggested delivery date, which was fine, and was all in good order. Money well spent.

Wanted to get a Leappad 2 for my 2 year old and I am so glad that I stumbled across this version.  I had been eyeing the Princess Bundle and then the Monsters Inc one... but this one was a no brainer!  The design on the side is really cute and perfect for my Doc fan.  Plus, the fact that it comes with the rechargeable batteries and a download card made it a better value than some of the other bundles.

This is a great tablet for toddlers. My 3 year old son enjoys playing on it and watching movies on it. It entertains him on long car rides and when I am getting dinner ready.
I had considered getting a cheap Android tablet for him instead of this but am glad I got him this tablet. The games are entertaining, totally geared towards kids, and educational. When left alone with the tablet, he will pretty much go through everything, and the tablet locks him out of making any changes to it.
The tablet is very durable. I noticed the other day that he was standing on it and it wasn't damaged.  He has dropped it numerous times and nothing has happened to it.
Don't expect a HD screen, the resolution isn't great, but is good enough for a small kid.

I had a feeling when I bought this that the apps would be a bit pricey but was suppressed once I saw the online app center. It is not like the Android or IOS prices where app prices are usually at a dollar to a few dollars. In the leap pad app center some are at $5 a majority of the apps are around $10, and some of them with name brands like Disney are at $25. So you may save some money on the tablet but you can quickly rack up large app purchase costs. I also feel that the $25 apps are not up to the quality of some of the $1 child apps you can get on Android and IOS.  I have found that the game cartridges on amazon are cheaper than the digital downloads from the app center.  I also found that the $20 app center gift card is listed on amazon for $15, so you could save some money that way if you do not want to buy the cartridges. One more thing I didn't know when I bought this item is that it has a pressure sensitive touch screen which doesn't work as well as capacitive touch screens like the iPad. My daughter likes it so far, I just hope that she doesn't get bored with the games to quickly.
My Granddaughter loves it.  I got it for her birthday.  She is only two but is able to do a lot of things on it.
Just ok. Wouldve preferred additional preloaded apps and easier maneuverability for a 3 u ear old. Overall an average alternative.

I bought the Leapfrog after reading the reviews and also talking to my daughter-in-law who is very "savvy" when it comes to electrionic devices..and I am very happy to report that it has lived up to it's reputation in every way..my grandaughter is completely in "love" with it and her parents have to moniter her use otherwise she'd be on it all day !

The LeapPad itself is fantastic, so I gave an overall 5 stars for the product.  The concept of having my kid play educational games, rather than watch dumb cartoons they put on TV these days, was great.  The only downfall is the price of additional games.  They range anywhere from $10 for $25 (of the ones I've purchased so far).  Though they are great and educational, they are still as simple as some android/iphone games offered for just $2/3 each.
Bottom line, my kid enjoys it, and though its costing me $10/20 a week for new games, I am still satisfied and feel that it's worth the money.
My three year old grandson loves his LeapPad2!  He didn't even need anyone to show him how to use it!

If I knew how awesome this thing was before I bought it, I would have picked it up when my daughter was two years old! Apps are great and the item is extremely easy to use for my 3.5 year old. The camera requires a lot of light wherever you are, if you want a clear picture.

This is our second Leap Pad.  We found it on Amazon for the same price as LeapFrog, but with free 2 day shipping!  It arrived on time in perfect condition.  we are very happy!  All the accessories we purchased were quality working products as well!

my other daughter has the original leap pad and it was great

Bought this for our 4 year old son for his birthday. He loved it! It was just as described and easy to use. In minutes he was like a pro.

First of all, this is a solid toy that does indeed have some value for kids.  However, with today's youth becoming more and more reliant on technology and skills such as telling time on analog clocks and writing in cursive already atrophying like the little toes on our feet from disuse due to increased use of computers, and little digital clocks on all the appliances in our houses, it's not a surprise that one company thought of the idea to make iPhoneish toys to attract the preschool crowd of consumers who have no money of their own to spend.

Parents, I've been teaching elementary school for 20 years, and have a solid reputation as an educator.  Please make sure you buy your kids a real book if you do end up buying this toy.  Make sure you read that book, or some book, to your children every night in addition to giving them electronics to occupy their minds. While this toy has some educational value, the true kids that succeed at school are those who come in knowing how to speak, count, read a little, write their names, and are familiar with social behaviors that allow getting along with other kids. Social behavior like sitting still to hear a story. This is a nice option for kids, but any child who is solely reliant on technology is going to be at an academic disadvantage from the start.
My grandson won't put it down and he is learning and actually starting to say words with it.  It is the best thing ever!  Thank you

The LeapFrog LeapPad2 Power learning tablet is a great learning toy for ages 3-8.  It's easy to set up by plugging it into your computer (mine recognized the device immediately) and following the prompts, the battery life is good (about 9 hours), tons of apps, and a happy kid! Bought this for my 4 yr old grandson. A big hit with him. He loves it. Had purchased the first Leap Pad for his older brother however this Leap Pad 2 has the rechargable batteries and that is wonderful.

I guess its good up until I saw the app center, OH MY GOD!! the apps are expensive,, E-Books will cost about $7.50 - $ 20, which I think its ridiculous, IPAD apps are WAAYY CHEAPER! I bought this for my son's 4th birthday. He loves it! There are a variety of games and accessories that go with it. I love that he is learning to read, write, do math, problem solving, and more - all while playing a fun game! I would definitely recommend this product to others!

The LeapPad2 is a nice step-up from the old LeapPad, but honestly if you can afford the cost difference, go for the Ultra instead. The Ultra has enough upgrades to make it worth the extra. Now if you're not sure how much your kids will like it, go for the Power version over the first LeapPad - the rechargeable battery will save your sanity.
My kids have always been pretty neutral with LeapFrog products, starting with MyPal, Tag, LeapReader, Explorer, etc. They enjoy them on and off, but they're never very attached to them. The LeapPad2 (in this case) is providing some entertainment, but again, they're not blown away by it. I should add that my youngest two (that use this) are 6 & 7.  This is also adding more play value to the games we already own for the explorer - yay!
So, to recap - it's good. If you have kids that aren't really into gadgets or technology - this is a good value. If your kids are always dying to get their grubby little hands on your tablet, then the Ultra is probably what you need ;)

The LeapFrog LeapPad2 Power Learning Tablet keeps up LeapFrog's excellent reputation for educational products while providing small children an entry point for learning how to use technological devices.  It offers a wide variety of available programs (some installed - others can be purchased and downloaded) that are both educational and fun.  It is almost like they have their own tablet and it helps avoid the possible dangers of small children handling much more expensive (and important for parents) devices.  It is a great product for allowing children to not only learn as they play, but also be comfortable with technology they will use their entire life.

Our sons have enjoyed several different LeapFrog learning electronics throughout the years, and each of them has been great.  The LeapPad2 Power Learning Tablet continues this tradition of quality, entertainment and teaching.

The LeapPad2 is squarely focused on learning games and apps but the great news is that your kids won't notice it because there is plenty of fun, creativity and imagination built in throughout the entire pallette of software choices.  Our six-year-old particularly enjoys using the camera and video recorder options and then making funny edits via the included Photo Lab app.

It's also solidly-built.  Ours has taken a few tumbles out of the car or off the kitchen table and continues to perform like the day it arrived.

The LeapPad2 comes in three models:  basic, Power and Ultra.  The basic and the Power are identical tablets - the only difference is that the Power package includes an AC adapter and rechargeable battery packs - both critical add-ons.  The two primary differences between this model and the Ultra above it are size (which I think that this LeapPad2 Power is already perfectly-sized for a five- to seven-year-old) and the addition of WiFi and web surfing.  Again, I think that this is actually in the Power model's favor - I enjoy knowing that there's an electronic device that he can enjoy and learn from without any connectivity that I then have to police and worry about.  For my money, the Power package is the way to go.

If you do not already own rechargeable batteries and a charger, then the LeapPad2 Power is a significant improvement over the original LeapPad2.  The price difference is only around $20 as of the time of this review, which you will quickly save in battery costs.  It claims to get 9 hours of playtime on a 4 hour charge, and that seems to be fairly accurate.  Charging the batteries simply involves plugging the AC adapter into the unit.  You don't have to remove a case, battery covers, etc.

Other than the inclusion of the rechargeable battery pack and AC adapter, it is almost identical to the LeapPad2.  There are 4 additional "apps" included with this model, which include a calculator, calendar, note pad, and clock/stopwatch.  Also, the color of the device is a bit different.  In short, if you already own the original LeapPad2, I do not think that upgrading to the Power version is worth the cost.  But, if you are buying a new LeapPad for your child, then this rechargeable unit is worth the small added cost.

My 3 year old daughter enjoys this learning toy.  Unlike our iPad and Kindle Fire HD, this LeapFrog products contains only learning games.  (I believe there are videos that you can purchase, but we do not have any.)  She is not tempted into watching videos like she is with the other 2 devices that we own.  She has dropped this on our hardwood floors on several occasions.  Other than a scuff on one of the corners, it still looks and performs like new.  I did put a screen protector on it, since her original LeapPad screen got scratched quite badly.  I had some leftover Kindle Fire screen protectors, and simply trimmed one of those to fit.  It isn't an exact fit but it is close enough.

Our little ones love their new LeapPad! We had a previous LeapPad in pink for our daughter, and my son really loved to play it...until he got his new green one (a "boy" color!).
- We really love the addition of the rechargeable battery pack. One of our biggest complaints was how fast the regular batteries were burned through. We started using our own rechargeable cell batteries for our previous LeapPad, but this one is awesome with it's own battery pack...don't underestimate how convenient this feature really is.
- Our kids love the apps...we downloaded an Alphabet Soup app and it's really helping to teach our son - and he loves to play it.
- The kids both love the photo and video apps, and use them frequently. They're easy to operate and understand, even for a 3-year-old.
- If you're comparing this to a Vtech InnoTab 2 (which we also have), here are the high points of the LeapPad: quicker set-up overall, faster response time, better stylus response, smoother design with sleeker feel, better interface for the kids.
I would really recommend this for preschool to early elementary kids - our kids love it!
I bought it for my grand daughter for her birthday and she has not put it down since. great learning device for the young

I already have the LeapPad 2, but this is the Power version which comes with a rechargable battery. My one main complaint for the LeapPad 2 was batterly life. If they lasted 3 full days it was a shock. I am beyond excited for the charger now. There really isn't much actual physical difference between the two versions however, except for the coloring of the outer shell. The specs are all the same. This version does come with a few more free apps to download, which is nice since those things are not cheap at all. My daugher already loves her LeapPad and now she can use this one more often without worrying about battery life. There is quite a bit to do with this tablet; boredom should never be an issue! Also, I've found it is very durable, when my 15 month old gets a hold of it and tries to chew/drop it. However, I do recommend buying a case for it.

This little LeapFrog tablet has provided hours of fun for a six year old!  He loves the camera/video feature and it has been in constant use while on vacation. Let's just say it isn't exactly kid proof and while asking for it to be waterproof and scratch-proof is unrealistic the design of this makes it more suitable for sitting and playing indoors then the rough-and-tumble life of a six year old boy.  Overall, we have had fun with this and will be looking into exploring the other, downloadable options soon.
My daughter really enjoys this product. The product came in perfect condition and the rechargeable batteries is well worth it. We are very satisfied!

Update:  Since when I purchased the product it came with a 3 month warranty from LeapFrog I emailed them about returning the product.  I got an automatic reply with a ticket number and then nothing.  So I went on their Facebook page and complained and they asked me to send another email to their facebook support group (two customer support groups???).  Well needless to say I got a response from my facebook email that they would not honor the warranty.  This is what they sent:

Hello Marlene!

It appears that you are not receiving the emails our Customer Support team is sending. We can see that they have been responding to your emails. You may want to check your SPAM inbox just in case.

Here is the most recent email:

Our apologies for the inconvenience.

We regret that we are only able to process a refund if the unit was bought directly from [...]  If your LeapPad2 Power was not turning on or charging, we are only able to provide you with a shipping label to send the device to us for testing. If this is how you would like to proceed, please provide us the following:

....and they asked for some personal information.  First - I check my spam filter everyday - so they were not sending me emails.  Secondly, I did indeed receive one email from them - the automatic response, so any subsequent emails would not have gone to spam.  Next - nothing in their warranty states that the product has to be purchased direct from them - on the outside of the box, nor does it explain that in the paperwork that you receive in the package.

Amazon posts the store or business that supplies the items directly after the title so if it is a secondary storefront - you will know.  This product said "By LeapFrog"

I am out $100.00 when you include the shipping.  Plus I purchased another unit to replace this one.  I have several grandchildren and maybe more on the way and have decided that they will not be getting Leapfrog products.  I will purchase the Vtech products instead.  I like the leapfrop products but the customer service is terrible and that counts for more than 50% of my choice when purchasing.

Unit is durable to a point, my child was able to shatter the screen. LeapFrog customer service is also great. I would purchase this unit to teach not only, as an intro to electric devices but for the programs it operates.

I've been thoroughly impressed with our Leappad 2. My son had no trouble at all learning to use the tablet even a couple of months after his 3rd birthday, although most of the games are designed for children at least 4 and up. I thought he might not like a tablet for kids, since he's been allowed to borrow Kindles and iPads, but it's proved to be very entertaining. The games and ebooks we've tried are fun but with a pretty strong educational component. I'm a huge advocate of limiting "screen time" for kids, but the learning and interactive aspects of the games make me feel good about letting him use these games in appropriate doses. Although he's a pretty careful guy, he is three and so far the Leappad has withstood the normal wear and tear with flying colors.

The addition of the rechargeable battery is a definite improvement, as it saves the expense and hassle of replacing batteries. The charging process is easy - just plug in the tablet with no need to open it up - and does seem to get the claimed 9 hours of playtime on a 4 hour charge. There's a subtle color change on the face of the tablet but otherwise the LeapPad2 Power seems to be identical to the regular LeapPad2. If you're going to get one, I recommend the Power, but it's certainly not worth an upgrade.

The only drawback I see is the price of additional games, but they do seem to be pretty high quality, with enough content to be interesting for quite awhile. There are some apps that come with the Leappad, but if you've invested in the Pad you'll want to buy additional games to really get the full value out of it.
I enjoy it very much. When my son plays it he enjoys it to. I'd recommend this product to anyone looking for a fun way for kids to learn.

My two year old daughter is an iPad/iPhone junkie; so for her 2nd birthday, I decided to buy a LeapPad2. Actually, after reading about a million reviews, I realized that the LeapPad2 with the rechargeable battery was the way to go. I am not technologically advanced, but I do know that I want my child to be. This toy is simply amazing.

First, set up was a breeze. I connected the USB to my computer and I was able to create a profile within a few minutes. I want to thank ck_361 "ck_361", for the free app codes. In case you missed it....

The Book of Super Awesome Stuff (e-book): 5813 1140 1518 1413
Alphabet Stew (game): 5813 0790 4610 4973

Second, the rechargeable battery is a life saver. I have to pry this thing away from my daughter. I could only imagine how many batteries I've saved.

Third, we splurged on a few cartridge games since it was a birthday present. We also bought some accessories, like the carrying case. I would have to agree with most parents...games do not come cheap. I doubt I will buy anymore cartridge games for $25, although I have noticed that Amazon/Toys R Us now has some of them on sale for around $17.

I pray this toy will last for awhile with no scratches or killer drops. It is definitely an investment. I love that she can grow with this toy and not be done with it after a few uses. So far so good! I think LeapFrog did a great job designing this toy. Depending on how much my 2 year old learns from her LeapPad2 will depend on whether or not we upgrade her to the LeapPad Ultra which also looks pretty cool too.

I love the leap pad 2. My son was seriously addicted to my iPhone and I had downloaded games for him but I didn't like that he was starting to learn how to use youtube etc. (he's only 2) so we bought this instead. He loves it, it took him awhile to learn to use as it's different to the phone but it is a great learning tool and the money is worth it. This is half the price here then it is in New Zealand (even with shipping) so it's a great bargain for anyone. The recharger pack will save heaps on batteries. Overall, we are really happy with this purchase and can't wait to buy more games. Thanks for making this affordable Amazon!

A huge disappointment !! This was bought as a Birthday gift for our 3 year old grandaughter based on the rave reviews it had received from other purchasers. We thought it would serve as a rather inexpensive and more durable alternative to some of the other multi [purpose and fully functional educational tablets that are currently in the marketplace. Boy were we wrong!

After receiving it and setting it up, we found that the ostensible educational programs that were included with the device were hokey and basically worthless. Thinking that maybe there were better programs available we took the next step and went to Leap Frog's home page to see what what other educational apps they had available and selected/ordered another one we thought might be better. But when we got it and tried it we were again disappointed at what we found both in terms of content, quality and price.

So we gave up! We sent it all back and bought her a Kindle Fire  instead! (for only $50 more I might add)!

From what we've seen already in just the short time she's had it, we believe that this may very well be the best decision we'll ever make as far as our grandaughter's continuing education is concerned.  She now has virtually unlimited access to all of the superb educational tools and apps that are currently out there that are not only AGE APPROPRIATE AND EDUCATIONAL but are FREE as well.

With that said, we cannot in good conscience recommend the LeapPad2 as an educational tool for any age group given the other viable tablet alternatives that are currently in the market.

So glad I got the one with the recharge kit - my daughter LOVES her tablet! I love that I can pick and choose what is one there. Many options for learning games in cartridges and on the online store. This thing is also quite durable.

Kids love it.  But they don't last as long as they should.  I have had more than one.  It comes on but keeps needing to be connected to computer and it should not have to. But as for selections of apps it is great.  Good product when it is working.
